title: SUN DON'T SHINE (CROWBAR, TYPE O NEGATIVE) Streams "The Promise Song"
description: They used to be called Eye Am.
author: Greg Kennelty
byline: By Greg Kennelty Published 2 hours ago
excerpt: They used to be called Eye Am.
text: Sun Don't Shine – the band featuring Type O Negative guitarist Kenny Hickey and drummer Johnny Kelly alongside current Crowbar frontman Kirk Windstein and ex-Crowbar bassist Todd Strange that used to be called Eye Am – is now streaming their new single "The Promise Song". "This one was a real example of shooting from the hip. I had the basic framework for the song having no real idea how it was going to come out," said Hickey. "Then Kirk laid his tracks and turned the bridge into a totally different animal, intensifying everything, and laid down a stellar guitar lead that deepened the entire track." "Brace yourself for a sonic storm," added Corpse Paint Records' Andrew Spaulding. "This new track 'The Promise Song' fuses raw power and haunting melody, a collision of legendary talent that redefines the genre and sets the stage for a new era of heavy music." html:
Sun Don't Shine – the band featuring Type O Negative guitarist Kenny Hickey and drummer Johnny Kelly alongside current Crowbar frontman Kirk Windstein and ex-Crowbar bassist Todd Strange that used to be called Eye Am – is now streaming their new single "The Promise Song".

"This one was a real example of shooting from the hip. I had the basic framework for the song having no real idea how it was going to come out," said Hickey. "Then Kirk laid his tracks and turned the bridge into a totally different animal, intensifying everything, and laid down a stellar guitar lead that deepened the entire track."

"Brace yourself for a sonic storm," added Corpse Paint Records' Andrew Spaulding. "This new track 'The Promise Song' fuses raw power and haunting melody, a collision of legendary talent that redefines the genre and sets the stage for a new era of heavy music."

Get "The Promise Song" physical copies and merchandise right here.
